items.headline: Mixed Close for US Markets as Inflation Cools, AI Worries Persist; Indian Indices Tumble
items.summary: U.S. markets saw a relatively steady close on Friday, February 13, 2026, finding some calm after a report indicated January inflation slowed more than expected. However, ongoing concerns about artificial intelligence disrupting various industries continued to cast a shadow, particularly over technology stocks. Meanwhile, benchmark Indian equity indices, Sensex and Nifty, experienced a significant broad-based selloff, primarily driven by weak global market cues and sharp declines in the metal and IT sectors. Not financial advice.

items.headline: US Foods Holding surges on strong earnings
items.summary: US Foods Holding saw a significant jump after reporting strong Q4 earnings and providing optimistic 2026 guidance.

items.headline: Equinix gains as price targets raised
items.summary: Equinix experienced a notable rise as several banks increased their price targets following the company's recent earnings and guidance.

items.headline: Motorola Solutions up on positive outlook
items.summary: Motorola Solutions shares climbed after the company issued strong 2026 guidance and reported solid fourth-quarter results.

items.headline: AST SpaceMobile drops on equity offering news
items.summary: AST SpaceMobile shares declined following the announcement of a follow-on equity offering.

items.headline: Pinterest plunges amid tech sector weakness
items.summary: Pinterest shares saw a significant drop in pre-market trading, reflecting broader weakness in the technology sector.

items.headline: Moody's falls on AI disruption fears
items.summary: Moody's stock fell sharply due to growing fears that advanced AI technology could erode its competitive advantages.

items.headline: Rotation Away from Tech as Industrials, Energy Lead
items.summary: There is a notable shift in sector preferences among US equity investors, with Industrials, Energy, and Basic Materials gaining favor. This rotation is partly driven by skepticism over AI investment, leading to a decreased preference for AI-related and technology stocks, which had been strong performers in late 2025. Utilities and Consumer Staples also showed resilience.

items.headline: Technology and Financials Continue to Lag
items.summary: Technology, Financials, and Communication Services sectors were among the worst performers. Financials have emerged as the weakest corner of the S&P 500 year-to-date, reflecting mounting pressure on banks and insurers. Concerns about AI disruption continue to weigh heavily on the tech and software industries.

items.headline: January Inflation Cools More Than Expected, CPI at 2.4%
items.summary: The Consumer Price Index (CPI) report for January showed inflation slowing to 2.4% year-over-year, down from 2.7% in December, and below economists' expectations. Core inflation also moderated to 2.5%. This cooling trend provides the Federal Reserve with more flexibility, reinforcing a cautious stance on immediate interest rate cuts.

items.headline: US Labor Market Shows Strength with 130,000 Jobs Added
items.summary: The US labor market continued to show strength in January, with 130,000 jobs added and the unemployment rate falling to 4.3%. This positive data suggests improving labor market conditions.

items.headline: Key Companies Report Q4 and Full-Year Results
items.summary: Cameco Corp. ($CCJ) reported strong Q4 net earnings of $199 million, beating analyst expectations. Kinsale Capital Group, Inc. ($KNSL) also surpassed estimates with a 25.8% rise in Q4 net operating EPS and increased its dividend. The Wendy's Company ($WEN) released Q4 and full-year 2025 results, aligning with expectations. American Axle & Manufacturing ($AAM) also announced its Q4 financial results today.
